definitions.text: a sudden intense burst of radiant energy

examples: a flash of emotion swept over him
the flashings of pain were a warning
he had a flash of intuition

definitions.text: a very short time (as the time it takes the eye to blink or the heart to beat)
examples: if I had the chance I'd do it in a flash

definitions.text: a burst of light used to communicate or illuminate
a short news announcement concerning some on-going news story
a bright patch of color used for decoration or identification
examples: a flash sewn on his sleeve indicated the unit he belonged to

definitions.text: a lamp for providing momentary light to take a photograph

examples: The headlines flashed on the screen

definitions.text: display proudly; act ostentatiously or pretentiously
examples: he showed off his new sports car

definitions.text: make known or cause to appear with great speed
examples: The latest intelligence is flashed to all command posts

definitions.text: run or move very quickly or hastily
protect by covering with a thin sheet of metal
emit a brief burst of light
examples: A shooting star flashed and was gone
